data.description:
R10083794 AI and Machine Learning Intern (Open)

Location:Newark, DE (ICD) - R&D - Electronics

The Innovation and Development Division (IDD) drives the innovation strategy for the Hubs and Operations, and contributes to the Group's transformation. It is responsible for imagining, developing and incubating new solutions until they are brought to market, particularly when it comes to offers with a high technological content (including digital and IT). IDD gathers more than 3,000 employees from 70 nationalities at 60 sites.How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?Air Liquide is Hiring for an AI & Machine Learning Intern in Newark, DE!At Air Liquide, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the unique perspectives of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders, and cultures across the world. We believe that a variety of backgrounds makes our team stronger and more innovative.We are looking for you!Pay: $24.00 - $30.00 per hourLength: 10 Week Internship ProgramRelocation: No Relocation will be provided for this positionWe are seeking a motivated intern to join our Electronics Materials division, focusing on the integration of AI, machine learning, and advanced digital tools. In this role, you will work to streamline complex data flows originating from our laboratory research to accelerate the development of novel materials. By collaborating closely with our team of researchers, you will help design and implement innovative methodologies that leverage AI to optimize data analysis. This is a unique opportunity to apply cutting-edge computational techniques to real-world laboratory challenges and drive efficiency in material science.ResponsibilitiesDevelop AI and machine learning tools to analyze laboratory dataSupport researchers in their research projects to streamline data acquisition and data analysisIdentify where AI and machine learning can support the efficiency improvement of our laboratory work and material discovery projects__________________Are you a MATCH? RequirementsCurrently pursuing a degree (Junior/Senior) in Computer Science, Data Science, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.Strong understanding and hands on experience with current AI and machine learning.  Strong programming skills in Python (specifically libraries like NumPy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).Familiarity with data visualization tools and an understanding of how to handle high-dimensional laboratory datasets.Ability to explain complex digital concepts to team members who may have a more traditional laboratory background.The candidate must have valid unrestricted employment authorization in the U.S. and must not require visa sponsorship now or in the future. Our Differences make our PerformanceAt Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
requirements: Currently pursuing a degree (Junior/Senior) in Computer Science, Data Science, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.
responsibilities: Relocation: No Relocation will be provided for this position
Develop AI and machine learning tools to analyze laboratory data
